diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Donovanosis (granuloma inguinale) of the middle ear with secondary parotid, cervical, and parapharyngeal lymphadenitis, mastoiditis, and meningitis.
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: bacterial infection, tuberculosis, squamous cell carcinoma
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Key findings included a large left-sided parotid abscess, left cervical and submandibular lymphadenopathy, and facial nerve palsy, with laboratory tests indicating raised inflammatory markers and imaging suggestive of necrosis and suppuration. Histology revealed large numbers of Donovan bodies, confirming the diagnosis.
